content.title: studiostagecollaboration
content.body:
in praise of folly is a Brussels-based string quartet comprised of classical musicians who are a unique product of their generation. Concretely, this translates into a philosophy of collaboration, expansion, and cross-genre performance.

In only a year of playing together, their collaborative musical approach has opened doors to exciting projects in jazz, pop, rock, chanson, and contemporary classical - both stage and in studio.

Among the highlights of this year, a tour across Europe with the Progressive-Rock band Marillion, sold-out Royal Albert Hall in October 2017; a string quartet written especially for them by young Belgian composer Mathias Coppens and first performed at the Festival Zomer van Antwerpen in July 2017; as well as an invitation to perform with Pol Belardi’s Force in the project Creation/Evolution at the Philharmony of Luxembourg in March, 2018.

They have also recorded on a number a jazz and pop albums this year including: John Anderberg’s True Veins (Sweden), the jazz ensemble Effdé (France), Jazz vocalist Emily Allison (Belgium), and Paris-based Emily Rambaud’s newest EP, Romance.
